page.title: 07Junior Outing from Wimbish
page.content: On July 5th all the school children from classes 1 and 2 enjoyed a day's outing to the Colne Valley Railway, Castle Hedingham, Essex. The station, rolling stock and lines have been placed there as a railway museum.The children, particularly the boys, enjoyed the old steam trains and the signal box. Their favourite was the Pullman Carriage, probably used by Royalty in the past when travelling to Brighton in Sussex. The picnic in the field was popular, and the sighting of a toad created some interest. After lunch there was a ride on the museum railbus. Then the children went to the nearby Castle where they saw dungeons and turrets. The skull of a deer on the wall helped to fire their imaginations into ideas of ghostly experiences.
